ApplicationSubmissionInfoGrp.FormAndInfoAndMaterialsTxt: http://www.us-gsk.com/html/community/community-grants-foundation.htmlTax Exempt Documentation, Executive Summary, Narrative Section, Budget Section Instructional Information & Financial Data.
ApplicationSubmissionInfoGrp.RestrictionsOnAwardsTxt: Foundation grants only to non-profit, charitable organizations & institutions exempt under section 501(c)(3).

GrantOrContributionPdDurYrGrp.GrantOrContributionPurposeTxt: To launch an educational initiative to promote literacy, opportunity, and equity in one of Appalachian North Carolina's economically distressed areas.
To support the College STAR Program
To continue providing assistance in the implementation and evaluation of the Ribbon of Hope Program.
Funding is to develop and implement a multi-year educational program to support science, technology, engineering and mathematics majors at NCCU.

Funds are to support the "STEM Center of Excellence", a re-configuration of Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics education which can be duplicated at other institutions.ANDWomen in Science program: To honor the GSK mentors for their years of service and dedication to this program.
This grant will provide bridge funding to support NC Healthy Start Foundation in its continuing operations.

GrantOrContributionPdDurYrGrp.RecipientPersonNm: Public School Forum of NC Inc
GrantOrContributionPdDurYrGrp.GrantOrContributionPurposeTxt: To fund an afterschool STEM System-Building Plan which includes developing a clearinghouse of best practices, curricula,trainings, and evaluation tools; coordinating state and regional efforts to bring together a diverse group of STEM stakeholders; infusing STEM into the state's afterschool professional development system, and connecting youth and adult mentors to programs statewide.

GrantOrContributionPdDurYrGrp.RecipientPersonNm: NC School of Science and Mathematic
GrantOrContributionPdDurYrGrp.GrantOrContributionPurposeTxt: To support the Step Up to STEM 2013-2014 enrichment program for underrepresented minorities.
To fund Child Health Awards.

This five-year grant supports development of an educational program called "The Big Picture." It uses distance-learning courses, on-site workshops, statewide events, teaching fellowships and online tools as part of a new model to integrate art into the classroom. The Big Picture provides teachers with resources to help students develop critical thinking and problem solving skills. The program is designed to reach 165,000 NC teachers.
To support activities that establish or expand local programs in health, science, and education to serve identified needs of local communities.
To upgrade the Center's online teacher professional development resources to Web-based interactive modules.
Women in Science program: To honor the GSK mentors for their years of service and dedication to this program.
Addition of Wingate University as 30th NC college/university included in Women in Science Program: To honor the GSK mentors for their years of service and dedication to this program.

GrantOrContributionPdDurYrGrp.RecipientPersonNm: The Center for child and Family Hea
GrantOrContributionPdDurYrGrp.GrantOrContributionPurposeTxt: To pay for family coping and resilience program to increase access, engagement and mental health service quality of NC's military families

GrantOrContributionPdDurYrGrp.RecipientPersonNm: The Center for Child and Family Hea
GrantOrContributionPdDurYrGrp.GrantOrContributionPurposeTxt: To pay for family coping and resilience program to increase access, engagement and mental health service quality of NC's military families

GrantOrContributionPdDurYrGrp.RecipientPersonNm: NC Institute of Child Development P
GrantOrContributionPdDurYrGrp.GrantOrContributionPurposeTxt: To develop a child care health consultant (CCHC) tiered certification process

To address health risks facing individuals with intellectual disabilities by reaching out to and engaging them in a behavioural shift, by incorporating physical activities, health screenings, wellness education, and weigh loss intervention activities.

GrantOrContributionPdDurYrGrp.RecipientPersonNm: The Down East Partnership for child
GrantOrContributionPdDurYrGrp.GrantOrContributionPurposeTxt: To support Recipient's two initiatives: Ready Schools and Ready communities
To provide local youth with an expanded offering of opportunities to participate in physical activities.
To expand the Councils instrumental and vocal education program to seven additional elementary schools, targeting all students in grades K-6.

To continue expansion of the Centers Scholars to College program, a year-round out-of-school program for low-income high school students residing in Durham County who are recommended by a teacher or counselor
To increase the number of tutors and for individualized tutoring sessions to low-income children who are reading at least one year below grade level.
To provide program expansion of the Foundations summer program to approximately 120 at-risk scholars at two elementary schools in Durham County.
To expand the Heart Math Tutoring program to a new school site.

To support math teachers through the Smoky Mountain Math Teachers Circle (SMMTC) and the North Carolina Math Teachers Circle Network AND Women in Science program: To honor the GSK mentors for their years of service and dedication to this program.
